text.p: Wasim Akram took six for 48 as Zimbabwe were shot out for 133
before tea on the opening day of the second and decisive test on
The left-arm pace bowler took three wickets in both morning
and afternoon sessions after he lost the toss and his side were
asked to field at Faisalabad's Iqbal Stadium.
Half Zimbabwe were out by lunch when the score was 88 for
five and they lost the remaining wickets for the addition of 45
as Akram claimed his best figures against the visiting side.
Zimbabwe's total was their lowest in Pakistan, one run fewer
than their 134 at Karachi in the 1993-94 tour.
Only Andrew Flower, with a fighting 61, defied the Pakistani
bowlers before he was last out, top-edging paceman Shahid Nazir
to debutant Mohammad Hussain at fine leg.
